If we have an interface, then it forces us to use the use same keys in configuration.
I could have:
alexa:
  skills:
    myskill:
      skill-id 'xxxx-yaaa-zz123' 
      locale-resolution: 
          default-locale: 'es_ES'

Having the interface forces us to reuse the same default-locale key in both http-server configuration and other configurations.

nodes.bodyText: This is redundant
Are bean's arrays injected sorted?
Yes
I've removed the sorting.
Setting an order here doesn't make sense because this is the primary bean

But if you inject every HttpLocaleResolver with Collection<LocaleResolver> and you sort the
resolver,  you would want the CompositeHttpLocaleResolver to have the lowest order. Specially, since we don't provide a way to disable CompositeHttpLocaleResolver.
There is no use case to inject all locale resolvers outside of the composite one. The composite one here is specific to HTTP so there shouldn't be a need to disable it.

I've removed the getOrderoverride. I still think it is more correct that CompositeHttpLocaleResolver
has the lowest order in a list of LocaleResolver,
We shouldn't use HIGHEST_PRECEDENCE because then its impossible to create one with a higher precedence
I've added a padding.
This should not be indexed. There will only be 1 bean of this type
